io.confluent.ksql.rest.server.resources.streaming

Class RecordFormatter

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.confluent.ksql.rest.server.resources.streaming.RecordFormatter

  • public final class RecordFormatter
extends java.lang.Object
    Formats records as strings.

    An instance will attempt to determine the key and value formats of the topic records it is asked to process. It does this by maintaining lists of possible formats for the keys and values and removes any formats that fail to deserialize any of the data seen. In this way, the list of possibilities will reduce over time.

    The list of starting formats is defined in the Format enum. The list of key formats also includes windowed variants, as defined in the WindowSchema enum.

    Where multiple formats are still possible, the current record is formatted using the first. Hence the order of formats in the list affects which format is used to format the output.

    If all known formats fail the output is formatted using Bytes.toString(), which can handle arbitrary bytes.

      • getPossibleKeyFormats

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getPossibleKeyFormats()
        Returns the list of key formats that are capable of deserializing all the keys seen without error.

        As more records are passed to format(java.lang.Iterable<org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.ConsumerRecord<org.apache.kafka.common.utils.Bytes, org.apache.kafka.common.utils.Bytes>>) the list is refined.

        Returns:
        the list of compatible key formats

      • getPossibleValueFormats

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getPossibleValueFormats()
        Returns the list of value formats that are capable of deserializing all the values seen without error.

        As more records are passed to format(java.lang.Iterable<org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.ConsumerRecord<org.apache.kafka.common.utils.Bytes, org.apache.kafka.common.utils.Bytes>>) the list is refined.

        Returns:
        the list of compatible value formats
